D34F673835954DED8D9CD1E502DD07D2.description:
Use French-language resources, such as individuals and organizations in the
community or technology, to increase cultural understanding

EBAB6CAD8B534A9480F3BBA9918FF5E4.description:
1. Analyze in French aspects of francophone cultures researched from
interaction with French speakers, and authentic media, entertainment, and
technology.

BDEEC0A1D6034696A1429246C61FEFFC.listId:
FIV.10 The student will apply more complex French language skills and expand cultural
understanding in opportunities beyond the classroom setting for recreational,
educational, and occupational purposes.

580E54E04E044945BB2575EFBBC9C58B.description:
3. Examine local, regional, and national differences in the cultures of countries
and regions where French is spoken and the culture(s) of the United States.

FBBC0AF06C494343B6FDADDE4817C06D.description: 2. Explain how members of francophone culture(s) perceive the United States.

D3C2FE1C406842B780FC231E552508E4.description:
1. Discuss the role of culture in the development of relationships between the
United States and countries and regions where French is spoken.

06B72042632C41C188CA351475830710.listId:
FIV.9 The student will identify and discuss cultural similarities and differences in
social, economic, and political relationships in the global community.

04247E7DFB4F45139AE071680FE212F8.description:
2.  Compare linguistic elements of French and English, such as time, tense, and
mood, and understand how each language uses different grammatical
structures to express these elements.

F234CA7CDBF6402F94351682A657A8F1.description:
1. Examine local, regional, and national differences in sound systems,
pronunciation, vocabulary, and usage in countries or regions where French is
spoken and in the United States.

31902A60C29D4CB698F81D26D869AD40.listId:
FIV.8 The student will expand understanding of English and other languages through
study and analysis of increasingly complex elements of the target language.

7860224D82AB455A970A2A1565C24289.description:
3.  Use French-language resources to analyze knowledge related to other subject
areas.

EC777FF52C43434185AD22384E4FEA9E.description:
2. Compare and contrast topics studied in other subject areas and those studied in
French class, such as authors and artists from francophone countries or
political and historical events that involve francophone countries.

467261A0833F462AB8B3639102D227E9.description:
1. Discuss and evaluate examples of the French language and francophone
culture(s) found in other subject areas

DDB6453EE0854D05995290567A964A21.listId:
FIV.7 The student will use French to demonstrate increased understanding of the
connections between content studied in the French class and content studied in
other subject areas.

522217B9C38342F08D3A61EB624ED9A3.description:
2. Engage in authentic or simulated situations that demonstrate understanding of
culturally appropriate practices.

6F83473153F24D7F87ED4EAB72A1904E.description:
1.Discuss how topics such as global challenges, advancement of technology,
and diversity issues illustrate the viewpoints, patterns of behavior, and
products of the cultures studied.

DE080CC50394451DB85D41390DFD768C.listId:
FIV.6 The student will analyze in French how various perspectives reflect the practices
and products of the cultures studied.

03D87ABFB4C14FAEAAF282CED924598E.description:
2. Use appropriate verbal and nonverbal presentational techniques, including
visual aids and technological support.

456A2432A9F64F19B7CD70A18AEEDE19.description:
1. Produce well-organized presentations that demonstrate a greater breadth of
linguistic and cultural knowledge.

0E72E13B10FE4987A418FD3D8C27EDAD.listId:
FIV.5 The student will produce and present in French original essays, poetry, plays,
podcasts, and stories.

0D2A4AD261EA4F41A5A0FD701F96A625.description:
2. Use style, language, and tone appropriate to the audience and the purpose of
the presentation.

658D51212EF543018C6A464E849F8039.description:
Present well-developed ideas on a variety of topics, using familiar vocabulary
and language structures and with minimal errors in spelling, punctuation, and
pronunciation.

804EFA6D163C4590B427BEEAA360B346.listId:
FIV.4 The student will relate information in French, combining learned and original
language in oral and written presentations of extended length and complexity.

54A89102607648CBBFFB45CF1AAB2E79.description:
Understand and respond appropriately to increasingly complex instructions
presented in informational materials.

4B3C0D1DF74443BAABE9FE640120E129.description:
1. Identify various literary elements, such as plot, theme, setting, and characters,
in spoken and written texts.

9A14FE149E5946779A4CE0FC27F38AC2.listId:
FIV.3 The student will understand spoken and written French found in a variety of
authentic sources.

0429AE7D552D4222BA214CC447C46F23.description:
3. Use paraphrasing, circumlocution, and other creative means to express and
comprehend ideas.

400376D60DDF4C438580FF1E297CFFCE.description: 2. Exchange ideas clearly, based on level-appropriate themes.

81B6CF51E7A74B4292E3924DC416A109.description: 1. Use a wide range of vocabulary, structures, and major time frames.

183CD2B3FAF5403097D2ECFE6FB47B63.listId: FIV.2 The student will sustain extended oral and written exchanges in French.

5C8FA1240E764C0793C73638E1CDA5FC.description: 3. Exchange information from a variety of authentic media sources.

70B6F63573824E7483E9059E0CEC7E95.description: 2. Exchange personal reactions to spoken and written information including contemporary and historical events and global issues.

A80E882D6699471393BCB63F133A000E.description: 1. Express and support opinions and elicit those of others.

21AAE2D2628D4B3FB15777D58264BC51.listId:
FIV.1 The student will engage in and discuss a variety of topics in both oral and written
forms of communication.
